intro: Senecio manengubensis, commonly known as the Manenguban Senecio, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in forested areas and has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, and its structure is adapted to thrive in humid, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
